page.title: 10Public Houses - 2
page.content: {The Chestnut Horse}in Easton is a fifteenth century public house, which was probably originally a farm house because it has a hayloft in the roof. It is very small and comfortable . It offers a pleasant bar and a room where Pool can be played . During the week it has a few customers but at the weekend it can have up to one hundred people, most of whom come from outside the village. {The Cricketers,}at Easton, was built in 1900 and may also have been a farmhouse. It attracts a lot of visitors who come for the pleasant surroundings and good food. It is also the home of the village darts team.
